website_summaries.verdict: A great option if you're looking for a disposable swim diaper, but it's not as absorbent as a reusable one.
pros: Fits well without pinching, chafing or leaking
Doesn't swell up like a regular diaper
cons: Some have said these don't absorb urine as well as some of the other diapers available

customer_reviews.title: Not Dora, but love more than the Huggies equivalent
customer_reviews.text: First I must preface this with - my baby has never pooped in the pool. We regularly attend swimming lessons and we'd been using Huggies everything including swim diapers which worked just fine. Baby is 2 now and he said he wanted "the Dora ones" so I decided to give these a try. They're SO easy to get on and off and the size 6 fits my kid perfectly (35lb 38.5" tall) Not super bulky like the Huggies. I'm a fan - until he poops - then we'll see what happens. :-) My only complaint would be that when they arrived they had Elmo on them...so not "the Dora ones". Luckily he either hasn't looked or doesn't remember.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: When i used mine in the water it was a minute ago,,(a while )bt i remember hating them..they didnt work in the water.they hardly worked over night.the first pee from the diaper would leak on the bed ,i thought they were the worst...thats really why i got them.i needed diapers in a pinch..i got these the Next day online in the mail of course ..aslso i think they were pretty expensive when i got them.close to 15$
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks everywhere. I do NOT recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Before we even got to the beach the diaper leaked everywhere. My baby’s bathing suit was soaking wet before we even got in the ocean. Definitely would not but these again. The rest are going on the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah David

customer_reviews.title: Great SWIM diaper
customer_reviews.text: These diapers fit well, do their job, and my baby seems comfortable in them. I never put them on until we are at the pool and ready to swim. It will not stop all urine from leaking around the legs. It’s made to not swell in water (aka they don’t absorb very much liquid) and to keep solid waste from making its way into the pool water. These diapers will be our go to for the rest of summer.
customer_reviews.author: Momster84

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This did exactly what I expected it too. We only needed 1 pack for the 2 weeks of vacation for my 6 month old! I'm unsure why people expect these to absorb pee - their purpose is to not retain liquid. It does well with making sure the bowel movement doesn't escape. (Haha) I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C

customer_reviews.title: they work
customer_reviews.text: Dont put them on unless you get in the water... they do not work like regular diapers when out of water. as long as they are used correctly... they work great
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I know time for potty training at age 2.5 but we started swimming lessons and want no accidents ... I love these! Compared to other hard texture brands we use these are day and night difference , soft , high cut out around thighs! My son was so comfortable today he had a super class !!!
customer_reviews.author: Madeira

customer_reviews.title: Fits big
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in size 6 diapers so i got size 5 splashers and they were just a tag big
customer_reviews.author: Justin S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great. NOTE to new parents. These DO NOT hold PEE only POO. we learned the hard way
customer_reviews.author: Ania

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably snug and cute enough to wear on its own
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves these. Other brands do the same job so just pick the ones that are most affordable. They are all essentially the same. They hold the poop, not the pee.
customer_reviews.author: Magnumbull

customer_reviews.title: These were nice and fit well
customer_reviews.text: My little guy absolutely loves the pool but we were having issues with leakage when he was wearing cloth diaper (he wasn't big enough yet). Although I prefer cloth I was in a pinch to get something quickly. These were nice and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Ruesner

customer_reviews.title: Worst. Diaper. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: The "easy tear sides" make the diaper impossible to use. The sides tear so easily that we were unable to get one diaper on the baby without it tearing. We went through the entire package. At first we thought they were supposed to open and re-close by design, but at a closer glance, we realized that the diaper is just made cheaply and the construction is poor. Once the diaper tears (the side opens), it's done. Worst diapers ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Simple disposable swim diapers. Easy to put on and take off because they are like normal diapers. Great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angela5

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works so far but luckily haven't had to find out about #2 yet. Suppose it also depends on consistency.
customer_reviews.author: mack

customer_reviews.title: if your LO is just starting to wear siz 3's, skip this diaper
customer_reviews.text: I love the pampers cruisers so thought we would try these for my 6mos old baby when she started swim classes, she just weighed in at 16lbs at her baby wellness exam and they leaked the first day before we even left for the pool and leaked the 2nd. The size range is too huge, they were not snug on her either. I'll try them again towards the end of summer or when she's nearing size 4 diapers but until then, we'll be using the Huggies little swimmers diapers.
customer_reviews.author: fadrienne

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The diapers work great for swimming. They fit well and have a great seal so there's no leakage in case of an accident.
customer_reviews.author: tredford

customer_reviews.title: Good enough!
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and really stay dry without ballooning out. Perfect for babies and toddlers who do more "exploring" in the water than actual swimming. No idea how they work with #2s though, or how well they prevent leaks on dry land since we switched to regular diapers between swims.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca E.

customer_reviews.title: The best baby/toddler swim diapers.
customer_reviews.text: These were great swim diapers for our little one. Held in the #2, while not soaking up any access weight in water or #1, and becoming a sea anchor.
customer_reviews.author: CTkiter

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I can't get too excited about diapers...but these fit well and do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: These are always great for a day at the pool and care in ...
customer_reviews.text: These are always great for a day at the pool and care in handy for our winter getaway to the water park.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Work great for poop. Don’t hold in pee though, so once your out of the water put on a normal diaper
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I would buy these again, hold up in the water very well
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda T.

customer_reviews.title: Only used one time with our 8 month old, ...
customer_reviews.text: Only used one time with our 8 month old, did the job, no issues. Definitely easier to tear the sides to take off!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will
customer_reviews.text: These worked great! Took our little guy on a cruise where they had a toddler pool, and we had no problems with accidents.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Bracken

customer_reviews.title: super convenient and works great
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient and works great for kids to play in water. I took these to beach and indoor pools, no problem at all
customer_reviews.author: Jay. L

customer_reviews.title: We have really liked past pampers products and expect to like these as ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these as a gift knowing it would be several months before we would get to use them for our daughter. We have really liked past pampers products and expect to like these as well, but don't have realistic feedback at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Bess J.

customer_reviews.title: These are pull ups, not diapers
customer_reviews.text: These aren't tear away diapers and they have a very strong powder smell.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my son who is 22 lbs and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Selby

customer_reviews.title: Essentials
customer_reviews.text: These were great- very absorbent and true to size. They were a nice addition to make swimming with a baby a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jess

customer_reviews.title: How does someone review diapers? If you have a ...
customer_reviews.text: How does someone review diapers? If you have a small child still in diapers and you are going to the pool/beach, this really is a necessity. Kept "everything" in while my little one enjoys the water.
customer_reviews.author: William's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: work well for the price
customer_reviews.text: works well but they don't have velcro sides, so you have to pull them up like underwear
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: These fit well. Haven't had any testing of their ability to hold in a poonami, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It contains it all. My daughter had nasty make ...
customer_reviews.text: It contains it all. My daughter had nasty make you wanna choke or pass out diarrhea, and not one bit leaked out into the pool. I will always and forever use these with my poop monster.
customer_reviews.author: T Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the swim diapers. We've been using them at our weekly swim class and we've had no issues. I think they are designed to what they are supposed to do. I only wished they made a size smaller than a 3-4. However, the diapers stay on especially after a swim cover is put on my son.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: One helpful hint: Don't put these on your baby ...
customer_reviews.text: One helpful hint: Don't put these on your baby until you are ready to get in the pool. They do not keep in urine.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Disposal Water Diaper
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 14lb daughter well. No leaking or diaper explosions while in the pool. Just wish they made them for babies under 13 lbs!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: We always order Pampers for our little one be it ...
customer_reviews.text: We always order Pampers for our little one be it regular diapers or swimming diapers. This swimming diapers were an exact fit to her as expected from Pampers product.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the poop out of the pool, but not ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the poop out of the pool, but not the pee. That is exactly how they are intended to work. Would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A must for toddlers in the pool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent diapers to use in the pool. They do not retain water the way regular diapers do.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: No problems here!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah water diapers! Pampers brand so can't go wrong. Yes they will be in a landfill for 50 years but I would rather have that then my kid's snickers bar floating in a public pool. ha
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love it, now the pool is protected from the poop
customer_reviews.author: Alex Freiria

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby happy parents
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves those diapers and we never had a situation with them :)
customer_reviews.author: Yani

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: These have not failed me yet. My kid has no issues with them and they hold up for hours at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: J-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Do their job
customer_reviews.text: my favorite swimmy diapers. I just wish they'd invent ones that I didn't have to slide off, as it is, I pack a pair of safety scissors to cut them off in case of a messy accident.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Do not try it yet but from touching it I can feel that pampers is maintaining the high quality
customer_reviews.author: MMG

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: THEY WORK WELL NO LEAKS WE ARE VERY HAPPY WITH THE DIPPERS.
customer_reviews.author: LONNIE

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: These were ok. Didn't work as good as expected. There was still some leakage.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are very pretty looking, and do not swell with water. We are able to slip the bathing suit right over them, although they also look nice just by themselves. We have not yet had a chance to test them in action, catching the poop :). Overall however, we are very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elektra

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Good for #2 - Not designed for #1
customer_reviews.text: I use this product and really like it. Luckily I have never needed it, but I do use them 4 times a week for swimming. I doubt these would catch any pee at all - by design they cannot be absorbent and not collect pool water. So if your kid pees any significant amount on the way to the pool or on the pool deck, I imagine it will leak right out. Them do seem to fit nice for holding in a #2. The description when I ordered read "144 count" and $.12/each. This is not the case. This is 24 diapers at $.70/each. I thought it was a great deal - too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Great for water
customer_reviews.text: Great for the pool. It's pretty absorbent and stays on even when it's completely full. I'd recommend these for those going to the beach or pool.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Great price great product
customer_reviews.text: Needed some swim pants for my grandbabies for our vacation. These were perfect and such a good price! They didn't sag or "blow up" from the water. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Gay Moore Fantozzi

customer_reviews.title: Works well in the pool.
customer_reviews.text: This really works well with my grandson in the pool with no "accidents" so far. I recommend this product for those who have toddlers and a pool.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad swim diaper, although they seem to be a little less padding than before!
customer_reviews.author: Jbear

customer_reviews.title: quick delivery, good product
customer_reviews.text: We used these for my son's first swim lessons, and they worked great! He wears a size 3 regular diaper, so these were a bit big, but they did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Still fine but good to know
customer_reviews.text: I might not have read the product details carefully, but turns out these are pull ups. Still fine but good to know.
customer_reviews.author: nikkippy

customer_reviews.title: Great disposable swim diaper!
customer_reviews.text: They did the trick and were an easy solution for swimming in the pool this summer. I will definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: These work well and keep everything where it needs to be. They don't fall apart in the water and don't get all soggy and heavy and waterlogged.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Martin

customer_reviews.title: good!
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love swim diapers! they work great, easy to use. These are not helpful outside of the pool, so don't try it. But they are great swim diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: So, when you go swimming to a pool or beach and you have little ones, make sure you purchase some swim diapers. I have tried both Pampers and Huggies, and I prefer Pampers, because the sizing seems to be a little more accurate. Thankfully we have not had an accident at the pool, because that would be embarrassing to see "lil floaters" from your litter floater. So, for a sense of security I choose Pampers... also they give you the codes to redeem for items with their Points to Grow program (I believe Huggies has something similar too).
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: they loved them used them at disney last week. thank you
customer_reviews.author: gene funkhouser

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: What is there to say, they work great. Worth the price. Would buy again but hopefully won't need them next swimming season.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Love the product once we got it
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves to swim. We ordered these diapers for an upcoming vacation to Mexico. Unfortunately the original shipment never arrived. However the sellers did a great job in replacing the item. We weren't able to use them for our trip but we use them for our trips to the pool. Our son gets very excited when we pull these our - he knows it means we are going to the pool (he's 1). Fits very well in our son, who is 33 pounds. If you love the water these diapers are a must!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the size 3/4 for my 5 1/2 month old. I followed the size parameters and these are the ones that were supposed to fit. They ended up being too big. We ended up having a little accident in these. Oops.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: No frills
customer_reviews.text: Need swim diapers for your toddler. These will work very well. No bells or whistles, just the ability to keep pee out of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great produc
customer_reviews.text: They work as the supposed too. Till now we did not have any accident in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Raag

customer_reviews.title: Do the trick but hard to put on
customer_reviews.text: My son has never had an accident with these in the pool but they are not easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: tugacrab

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: These work fine, they're a bit baggy in strange places but my son was too big for the smaller size and too small for this size, it works though.
customer_reviews.author: macaroniandliam

customer_reviews.title: Also didn't swell like like a traditional diaper
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well! Also didn't swell like like a traditional diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amit Merchant

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and work wonderfully. Have been using them for over 6 months for my toddler and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: baljinder hothi

customer_reviews.title: swim diapers
customer_reviews.text: Faster and easier than going to the store. Actually it was even cheaper than the store. Made our trip to Mexico simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: They do the job of no issues in the pool. Haven't had any problems & they fit him well & are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: best item
customer_reviews.text: Best item for toddlers. I love this swimming diaper the best.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Eunsul Kim

customer_reviews.title: These work fine as swim diapers
customer_reviews.text: Prefer Huggies which have adjustable sides that make it easier to remove. These work fine as swim diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good swimming diaper
customer_reviews.text: The diaper keeps everything in and doesn't swell up. I like that the side seams rip open when getting changed after swimming
customer_reviews.author: S. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered. My little one loves to swim and I like taking her to our condo pool. This helps prevent any mishaps :) thanks
customer_reviews.author: Candice singh

customer_reviews.title: tried and true
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves to swim. Only once did she poop in these diapers, and it held it in perfectly. Recommended to moms of little swimmers.
customer_reviews.author: SareBear

customer_reviews.title: Serves the Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special to these. A good product but I would redesign the hip/front back connective tissue to be more durable as it occasionally ripped when putting on.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: great for pool time fun!
customer_reviews.text: don't even think about trying to put you baby in a pool with a regular diaper, it doesn't work! these are great.
customer_reviews.author: dangersneakolik

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient to be able to buy online in the winter months. We use these at the pool, and haven't had any trouble with them leaking. We cover them with plastic pants, just to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for the last 6 months since my 22 month started swim class. Fits well and stays on tight. Haven't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to put these suckers on my little girl, but taking them off is so SUPER easy - just rip the sides. Love that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Vienneau

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it but son has hard time keeping them up when wet
customer_reviews.author: Joe k

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is half the price in a regular store and 1/3 the price of the retailers near our beach vacation! Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Shannon D.

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Works well, we have an indoor pool & swim diapers are required. These came quickly & products like this make prime worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth L

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These did help when my grand daughter was in diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Pearson

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected, sized correctly. Although I am confused on which is the front and which is the back, or maybe it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Holden

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for the Pool
customer_reviews.text: I really like these diapers. I just wish they had tabs to remove the diaper versus having to tear them off.
customer_reviews.author: WonderWoman24

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well! Easy to get on and off. A tip-the sides to tear so once you are out of the pool/sea, just tear the sides apart so you don't have to pull them down!
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I can never find these in stores. My daughter is allergic to the Huggies brand so I'm glad these are offered here.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great for swim class!
customer_reviews.text: We have not had any leaks with these swim diapers. I like how I can rip them off when done.
customer_reviews.author: DRepka

customer_reviews.title: Pampers wins for us, hands down!
customer_reviews.text: Huggies gave my LO a terrible diaper rash, so Pampers win for us! And we like the pull-on style and the fact that you can wash them and reuse them at least once! Save money, reuse and reduce.. it's better for everyone! :)
customer_reviews.author: Freude

customer_reviews.title: Would use again
customer_reviews.text: Work great! Easy to rip open sides when there's a mess to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Bakker

customer_reviews.title: Great swimmers
customer_reviews.text: Great swimmers, especially for the summer months, make sure they are snug though. Due to the waterproofing properties, it will not hold any accidents, so if they are bigger than the size needed, beware! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Dia

customer_reviews.title: Still haven't figured out the usefulness of swim diapers...
customer_reviews.text: So, I have read LOTS of reviews for swim diapers and I've learned that swim diapers are really just there to prevent any poo from getting into the water, at the pool. I also learned that they are not supposed to absorb pee at all. My husband and I learned this the hard way, when my son (5 mo) peed all over the sidewalk while we chatted with his parents after a trip to the splash-pad near our home. They really do NOTHING to absorb the pee.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. Kiddo has gone through multiple weeks of swim lessons with these and no issues to report.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Pack open and diaper missing
customer_reviews.text: This pack of diapers was open and missing a diaper. Not cool!
customer_reviews.author: kim spina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome to go in the water but as they are pull ups they could be more snug around the waist
customer_reviews.text: Awesome to go in the water, they do not bulge, do not become heavy and yet, somehow, seem to trap pee and poop pretty well. I tried regular diapers in the water and this is really way better and seems much more hygienic. Nothing leaks out from the sides but a readjustable waist would help prevent leaks from the upper part. Maybe it is because my 6 month old is lean and long (85th percentile in length for 20th percentile in weight...)
customer_reviews.author: Mbud

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: These diapers do not swell up and they contain the contents of a dirty diaper. We will use these for the rest of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Jholman1019

customer_reviews.title: decent swim diapers - not as good at "the other" brand
customer_reviews.text: These are a decent swim diaper that keep in the poop. I guess that's all that matters. Compared to the next leading brand, however, they are thin and they have a lower rise. I like how the other brand goes up higher, right at the bellybutton. They just feel stronger and of better quality. Again, these do the trick. But for my money, I'll be buying the Little Swimmers from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie H.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little unsure about the slashes but I figured I would give it a try. They stay on perfectly. I have tried my hand at using regular diapers in water and it gets bogged down and very heavy. They start to fall apart. Not these!! They stay the shape it was intended to be. They do not get heavy or bogged down. They have cute designs of them!! We have had no leakage and we love it. They are definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Emily A

product_meta.title: Pampers Splashers Disposable Swim Diapers, Size 3/4, 24 Count, JUMBO
product_meta.description:
Style:16-34 lb, Size 3/4 - OLD VERSION

Perfect for pool time or the beach
view larger Perfect for pool time or the beach. Your little baby can splash happy without you having to worry about a soggy diaper.

Pampers Splashers swim pants are specially designed for pool or water time. They provide protection against leaks in the water, but won't swell like regular diapers. Their tear-away sides make it easier for you to change them, and they’re super stretchy to provide a snug fit in the water. Plus, the double leg cuffs provide protection from leaks. These diapers are ideal for the beach or pool time.

Pampers Splashers Swim Pants come in sizes 3–4, 5, and 6.

PAMPERS REWARDS
GET REWARDED FOR BUYING PAMPERS!
Collect Pampers Rewards points for every Pampers purchase you make. Then redeem your points for fun rewards at Pampers.com.

KEY FEATURES
 * Won’t swell up in water like regular diapers
 * Fun Dora & Diego design
 * Great for pool time and the beach

view larger Won’t Swell Up in Water
Regular diapers swell up when they get wet. Splashers don’t, so your baby can splash happy.

view larger Easy to Put On
And easy to take off with their tear-away sides, which are also super-stretchy for a snug fit in the water

view larger Protect Against Pool-time Leaks
Splashers double leg cuffs help protect against leaks

view larger Take Dora and Diego to the Pool
Fun designs, perfect for girls and boys

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
How many diapers will I change a day?
In the first couple of months, you may find yourself changing diapers up to 10 times in 24 hours. Diapers should be changed whenever they are wet or soiled. Your baby will often (but not always) let you know. With a super-absorbent diaper like Pampers, you can tell if it's wet by feeling for lumps in the absorbent material.

Here are some common times for changing diapers:

 * Right before or right after every feeding
 * After every bowel movement
 * Before bedtime
 * When your baby wakes up
 * When you go out with your baby

Is there anything special I need to know about changing a diaper?
Pampers Diapers are designed to adjust to your baby's shape for a snug, comfortable fit. While you’re changing diapers, there's no need to fold the waistband in or out or to adjust the leg cuffs.

 * Place tabs parallel to the waistband and centered on the character strip.
 * Use the characters as guides to ensure the fasteners are evenly spaced.
 * Keep baby products such as powder away from the fasteners so they maintain their stickiness.

What size diaper is right for my baby?
Just like you, babies like to wear things that fit just right. Choose a size that does not sag or gap, even as your baby crawls and plays. This will help prevent leaks. Each product description on this site gives guidelines that represent the average weight for a particular size. And remember, when you move up a size, you gain absorbency.

What’s the best method to weigh my baby?
The easiest way to weigh your baby is to first hop on the scale yourself. See how much you weigh, then see how much you weigh when you hold your baby. If you subtract your weight, you'll know how much your baby weighs.

Is there any safety information I need to know about diapers?
You buy the latest toys, and babies wind up playing with silly things—like diapers. It's important to keep diapers where they should be, on your baby's bottom. Don't let your baby put the diaper in his mouth. Discard any diaper that has become torn or unsealed, and read the warning label on all bags.

How do diapers absorb all that moisture?
AGM is the absorbent gelling material widely used in diaper padding to absorb wetness. It is perfectly normal to see some gel on the skin from time to time, especially if the diaper is heavily saturated. It can easily be removed by wiping your baby's skin.

This material has a long history of safe use in a variety of products and has been in diapers for more than a decade. Absorbent gelling material is closely related to ingredients widely used in cosmetics and in food processing.

Do unused diapers need to be stored anywhere special?
Store your diapers in an area protected from extreme heat and humidity and away from products with fragrances. We recommend the diapers be kept in a dry storage area where the temperature is 85 degrees or less.
